column1: If we want to go far we must go together.   Each day @realDonaldTrump refuses to work with President-elect Biden's transition team is a day lost to fighting the COVID-19 pandemic. And with over a quarter of million Americans lost to the virus we simply cannot wait any longer. https://t.co/ppAkRa21Jy

A quarter of a million Americans lost to #COVID19. Countless families friends and loved ones that are forever changed. And this fight is still not over.  It did not have to be this way but together we can still make a difference. Please mask up. https://t.co/VcAcwzIsYw

As elected officials we have an obligation to ensure the voices of the American people are heard.  As the #COVID19 pandemic continues to surge and devastate our communities and economy Americans are loud and clear: they need financial relief and they need it now. https://t.co/cmRFHuyHds
It is on each and every one of us to slow the spread of COVID-19. That means: 🧼 Wash your hands 😷 Wear a mask  🤧 Stay home when you're sick 🤒 Get tested
With cases of COVID-19 on the rise around the country it's crucial we in the First State must remain guided by science and continue to prioritize the safety of others. https://t.co/YoxQrFOFNA

We are in a pivotal point in our battle against COVID-19.   Help keep your community safe by wearing a mask social distancing and getting tested at a location near you. Learn more here: https://t.co/DAJIISUbg9

The COVID-19 pandemic continues to rage on and families need relief. Let's get this virus under control and get Americans back to work by investing in good-paying green energy jobs. https://t.co/K4zDNQ8B6s

I often say that we need to find out what works and do more of that.   Well @JohnCarneyDE found out what works. So now let's follow his lead and do more of it.   Wear your masks social distance and avoid large crowds. Together we'll get through this. https://t.co/636SZuuFV3

In the midst of a deadly pandemic we cannot afford to move backward.  We have an obligation to ensure that the millions of Americans living with a pre-existing condition – including the over 10 million with COVID-19 –  have access to quality affordable health care #WhatsAtStake

There's no doubt that today's vaccine news is an important step forward. But it’s not time to spike the football.   Wearing a mask continues to be one of the most effective means to slow the spread of #COVID19 and help keep our friends family and community safe. https://t.co/Q8J463WmOU

Let’s compare.   - Dr. Fauci is one of our nation’s most trusted and experienced public health experts.  - Donald Trump still doesn't have a national testing strategy disregards basic facts about #COVID19 and is knowingly putting American lives at risk.   Listen to Dr. Fauci. https://t.co/V3dm1YjzCo
They’re now saying it plainly and out loud.   It’s not just that the Trump Administration has no plan to address the coronavirus — they aren’t even trying. https://t.co/ly5ixx2Mm2

Republicans are rushing through their SCOTUS nominee in the midst of an election a pandemic and record unemployment.   If only they had the same motivation to provide much-needed COVID relief to the millions of Americans facing unimaginable financial strain. https://t.co/klS3z6IZWr

I learned why @SBA_Delaware gave awards to @myplacers owner Chris Burkhard and @Cnufit owner Evans Armantrading when I visited their businesses today and saw how they pivoted their operations for their clients during the #COVID19 pandemic. Bravo Zulu! https://t.co/lJD90LXxhK

Fascinating work is going on right at @ChristianaCare and @GeneEditingDE . Today I met with @JaniceNevinMD and Dr. Kmiec who is leading scientists at the Gene Editing Institute to advance research in cancer inherited diseases and #COVID19 using the #CRISPR gene editing tool https://t.co/pQjdcwIoGW

Striking down the ACA would let insurers once again discriminate against:  🩺Nearly 400000 Delawareans with preexisiting conditions 🌡Over 20000 Delawareans who have been diagnosed with #COVID19 🏥Over 62000 Delawareans enrolled through Medicaid expansion  That's #WhatsAtStake

Since May Senate Republicans have sat on their hands instead of considering #COVID19 relief. Now they want to rush through a SCOTUS nominee in a matter of weeks in order to take away the health care of millions of Americans in the midst of a pandemic.   Shameful. #WhatsatStake

Over 7 million Americans have been diagnosed with #COVID19.   That's 7 million Americans who could face higher health care costs if Republicans successfully overturn the #ACA.   I won't stop fighting to ensure the ACA remains the law of the land because that’s #WhatsatStake.

As elected officials we have an obligation to ensure the voices of the American people are heard.   As the #COVID19 pandemic continues to surge and devastate our communities and economy Americans are loud and clear: they need financial relief – not a rushed #SCOTUS nomination. https://t.co/FHWt81f4KR

It's hard to imagine a time when our nation needed to heed the advice of experts more than we do at this very moment.   Yet in the midst of a global health crisis reports are emerging of political interference at @HHSGov to downplay the seriousness of #COVID19. https://t.co/NlNsIPZq4B

First and foremost I’m wishing the President and First Lady a quick and full recovery from this dangerous virus.   COVID-19 can affect anyone. We must all do our part to prevent its spread including listening to public health experts and wearing a mask to keep each other safe. https://t.co/TVzJP1qaZb

We need to do more to help the most vulnerable among us.   Renters deserve to have protection against eviction and homelessness during the #COVID19 pandemic. That's why I'm proud to cosponsor @SenSherrodBrown's bill to do just that – because it is simply the right thing to do. https://t.co/1mqqKBCqly

We cannot become complacent in the fight against #COVID19.    It is up to each and every one of us to do our part to combat this deadly virus. Wash your hands. Socially distance. And please wear your mask. https://t.co/1SZBWLV7IV

More than 1 million people have died from #COVID19. The US has more 20% of those deaths even though we account for less than 5% of the world’s population.  And now is the time that Republicans are rushing to dismantle the ACA and take health care away from millions of Americans. https://t.co/xgfb6j1dux
If you haven't claimed your coronavirus relief check yet you have until October 15th.    Don't wait! Learn more here:  https://t.co/Gpot6olhn8

As the #COVID19 pandemic continues to surge and devastate our communities and economy some Americans are still waiting for their desperately needed coronavirus relief funds.    That is unacceptable. https://t.co/qoWgWbbjli
We have now lost over 200000 American brothers sisters moms dads and grandparents to #COVID19.  A reminder: it did not have to be this way. https://t.co/zusHMoPLnF

200000 Americans lost to #COVID19. 200000 families that are forever changed. And this fight is still not over.  Together let’s demonstrate the leadership this country desperately needs that @realDonaldTrump fails to provide. Let’s each do our part to keep our communities safe.

.@USPS was ready and willing to play a critical role in keeping Americans safe during the #COVID19 pandemic. But the Trump Administration let politics drive the day instead.   Another absolute failure of leadership. https://t.co/4gVnxRFRGW

This was back in May so let me update some things for you.    Today we have:  - 190000+ American lives lost to #COVID19  - A life-threatening hurricane bearing down on the Gulf - A West Coast on fire   This morning we'll (again) see:   Senate Republicans waste @HSGAC's time. https://t.co/YLXvdh6LZX

Each and every one of us has a responsibility to help stop the spread of #COVID19.   You can help do your part by downloading Delaware's official app designed to assist contact tracers around the First State.  To learn more visit --> https://t.co/5G6ngI1BIx https://t.co/ebTEIpE3sz

More than 190000 American lives have been lost to #COVID19. Much of the West is grappling with catastrophic fires.  It’s hard to imagine a time when we needed to embrace science more than we do at this very moment.  Yet the Trump Administration is focused on #CensoringScience. https://t.co/CV7I8d000R
🚨 REMINDER 🚨   It’s quick and easy to get tested for #COVID19. Find a drive-through testing site near you by clicking here —>https://t.co/Fx7A39T9Ca

Today I visited Delaware Technical Community College’s Owen Campus in Georgetown to thank @DelawareNG and @DelawareEMA for their critical work testing Delawareans for #COVID19 up and down the First State. https://t.co/RTtSEIunBt
A reminder that the Trump @EPA has pursued several rollbacks over the course of the #COVID19 pandemic that will lead to more polluted air and thousands of more deaths.

Today I visited @camprehoboth as they celebrate 30 years of promoting inclusion and community development.   Even in the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic they are dedicated to building a safer community with room for all. https://t.co/jDoJzxjEao

I’m proud to have the support of @LungAssociation @TobaccoFreeKids @American_Heart @AmerAcadPeds and @ACSCAN in the fight against tobacco use and reduced health care costs in the #COVID19 pandemic.   Together we're determined to push for a safer and healthier America. https://t.co/JNzjEI7eXh

Today I introduced legislation to do just that: help Americans quit smoking and reduce health care costs. My bill will make it easier for millions of low-income Americans to improve their health and reduce the worst symptoms of #COVID19. https://t.co/k8ScEqpz8x

Every day public health experts are learning more about coronavirus - like that smoking is associated with a higher likelihood of #COVID19 progression.   That's why it's clear: there is no better time to be doing all that we can to help smokers kick the habit for good.

We simply cannot wait any longer.    We need to ensure renters have the protection they need against eviction and homelessness during the #COVID19 pandemic. That's why I'm proud to cosponsor @SenSherrodBrown's bill to do just that – because it is the right thing to do. https://t.co/EKdVHWFA1F

I often say that we need to find out what works and do more of that.   We know what works to help slow the spread of #COVID19: wearing a mask social distancing and avoiding large crowds. So let's do more of it.  https://t.co/xFslrIT1zi

The #COVID19 pandemic is hitting every part of this country – from chicken farms and food packaging facilities to the aisles of your local grocery store.  We can't wait any longer to get Americans the additional financial relief they desperately need. We need COVID-19 relief now. https://t.co/P7SC8Obins

With tourism and commerce at a standstill states and local governments are seeing billions of dollars in lost revenue.   Let's be clear: this is not a red state or a blue state problem. It's a United States problem. And the next #COVID19 relief package must reflect that. https://t.co/l0fOU4u7q9

I'm calling on my Republican colleagues in the Senate to provide much-needed aid for state and local governments in the next #COVID19 relief package.   As elected officials we have a responsibility to heed the call of our communities and get them the help they desperately need. https://t.co/oR1pqlpmsh

The more our small businesses suffer because of the financial toll of #COVID19 the more at risk we put our entire economy.   We need to pass long overdue aid so that these economic drivers the Americans they employ and the communities they serve don't take an even bigger hit. https://t.co/0VbCGTQaBv

The #2020Census will determine where billions of dollars of federal funding goes — including funds crucial in helping to prepare for future healthcare crises like #COVID19. But the Trump Administration is once again attempting to threaten its accuracy. https://t.co/AckkcZiTjH

It shouldn't be a surprise. The costs of addressing COVID-19 have exploded. Meanwhile tourism has halted. Income tax revenues have fallen as unemployment has shot up. Sales tax collections and revenue from gas taxes and tolls have dried up.  That would leave any state in the red

Mitch McConnell and the Trump Administration like to blame certain states for their revenue losses during the coronavirus.  That's ridiculous and just plain wrong.  Let's be clear: this isn't a red state problem or a blue state problem. This is a problem for the United States.

This afternoon I'm leading my Senate colleagues in calling for long overdue funding for our state and local governments in the next coronavirus relief package.   There's no more time to waste.  TUNE IN: https://t.co/27YjDnSoGP

Communities with higher rates of #COVID19 infection and death are also facing disproportionate air land and water pollution.  After months of inaction the GOP's plan lacks the compassion resources and support our nation’s #EnvironmentalJustice communities urgently need. https://t.co/GpNcyUK7iu

I'm proud to cosponsor bills led by @SenSherrodBrown and @SenJackReed's to ensure both renters and homeowners have the protection they need against eviction foreclosure and/or homelessness during the #COVID19 pandemic. It is simply the right thing to do.

In the First State alone nearly half of renters spend more than 30% of their household income on housing costs. With rent due in just two days and the increasing financial toll of #COVID19 it's critical these families and all Americans receive the help they desperately need. https://t.co/HNRUv4rEY2

The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed the cracks in our public health system. In too many parts of the U.S. public health departments are relying on paper and pencil fax machines or old software to collect and share COVID test results. This is unacceptable. https://t.co/JSfeJrjA2x

🚨REMINDER🚨   Even if you test negative for #COVID19 it's critical you continue social distancing wearing face coverings and washing your hands because it's up to each and every one of us to stay vigilant and help keep our communities safe.

While a record number of my Senate colleagues and I work hard to get #DCStatehood over the finish line we have a chance to make sure over 700000 U.S. taxpayers are treated fairly right now. Let’s make sure DC receives equal funding in the next #COVID19 relief package.

Our fellow Americans living in Washington DC do not have equal representation here in Congress and because of that they were shortchanged critical help in the last coronavirus relief package despite paying more in federal taxes per capita than citizens of any other state.

#COVID19 is surging front line workers are still seeing shortages of critical testing and PPE and hospitals are becoming overwhelmed. The economic fallout of this crisis has devastated communities nationwide – including those in our nation’s capital. And they need help.

The #CARESAct provided every state at least $1.25 billion in coronavirus relief funds.   Washington DC received less than half of that – despite it having more residents than states like Wyoming and Vermont.   This is unacceptable.

As we work on another much-needed #COVID19 relief package for the American people we must remember that one of our most important responsibilities is to be good stewards of taxpayer dollars.   My bill with @SenJohnKennedy will help ensure a mistake like this won't happen again. https://t.co/X4yJL11jyc

Our job as elected officials is to ensure all teachers and students have the resources they need to both stay safe and succeed this school year. It’s yet another reason why we need to provide much-needed funding to our state and local governments in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/rAgr3ptt7L

As a recovering governor and former chairman of @NatlGovsAssoc I understand the importance of providing support for state and local government budgets that have been devastated by #COVID19.  Here's a strong case by the former chair of @federalreserve on why we need to help now. https://t.co/E0Lk7krQ2v

This is beyond alarming and @realDonaldTrump should explain this change immediately.   Medical data that is critical to mitigating the spread of #COVID19 and saving lives simply cannot be politicized. https://t.co/cXFvdtiej1

Good piece in today's @nytopinion about how nations that took #COVID19 seriously and acted early on are now safely reopening their economies.   I always say find out what works and do more of that. We know what works — and the Trump Administration needs to do more of that now. https://t.co/tc4AEOCq1S

#COVID19 cases are surging front line workers are facing shortages of PPE and hospitals in certain regions are becoming overwhelmed.  But instead of focusing on real issues the Trump Administration is making matters worse by cruelly targeting our international students. https://t.co/QQwH1w31Ds
Under President Trump the U.S. is leading the world on coronavirus that’s for sure. https://t.co/vrFQBI5X1k https://t.co/m2avXY4tgK

Today we also remember that it's impossible to have life liberty and the pursuit of happiness without true justice for ALL Americans — including Black Americans who are disproportionately affected by the crises facing our nation today: #COVID19 and police brutality.

#COVID19 cases are on the rise across the nation hospitalization rates are increasing in some U.S regions and 47 million Americans are now unemployed.  We can't put relief off for our states hospitals and businesses. We must act with the sense of urgency this pandemic demands https://t.co/7kwg5Ti23E

This week the number of lives lost to #COVID19 passed 122000 we've set a new record for single-day positive #COVID19 cases and 47 million Americans are now unemployed.  But @realDonaldTrump is still steadfast in his efforts to take away health care from millions of Americans. https://t.co/QnFavOO8uE

To date we’ve lost 123000 Americans. Yesterday we saw the 3rd highest daily total of #COVID19 cases. We're not even out of the first wave and experts tell us to expect a second.  Every American should be livid that their health isn’t what’s being prioritized in a pandemic https://t.co/xQncjCyK3V

Expanding our testing capabilities is key to our efforts to trace #COVID19 and save lives. Now for the health and safety of the American people we need the President of the United States to recognize this too.

On top of the fact that the President asked for #COVID19 testing to be slowed down the Trump administration has reportedly been sitting on $14 billion that Congress allocated to help expand #COVID19 testing and contact tracing in our communities. https://t.co/xEZW95yZnk

A recap of the weekend: The President fires a U.S. attorney without reason; The President admits to "slowing down" #COVID19 testing at a rally experts warned against; and John Bolton calls him "dangerous for the Republic."  I wonder why he's concerned about more Americans voting? https://t.co/PzACZHSUWc
We also remember the thousands of families who have recently lost fathers to #COVID19 and fathers who are sick and don’t get to be with their loved ones today.

As we battle #COVID19 we have seen refugees — many of whom have fled unimaginable circumstances — on the frontlines of this crisis helping protect and save others.   They are our coworkers our neighbors and our friends and we proudly stand with them on #WorldRefugeeDay. https://t.co/MHySNPkPf2

Today I visited a #COVID19 testing site in New Castle County with @MattMeyerDE and even got tested myself. It was quick easy and free!   I'm proud to have supported the #CARESAct which made this site and others like it possible.   Interested in getting tested? Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/s2s6hYEbAp

Our nation can't overcome a public health crisis like #COVID19 without Americans having access to quality affordable health care.    That's why my Democratic colleagues and I will continue pushing to #FundMedicaid in the next relief package.

The U.S. represents less than 5% of the world's population but we account for more than 25% of the world's #COVID19 related deaths with 111000 lives lost.  If we had a President who took this virus seriously from the outset I think that number would look very different today. https://t.co/yTswbouBA9

Attention Delawareans: In the coming weeks the IRS will continue issuing #COVID19 stimulus payments in the form of debit cards.  These payments are not junk mail. Please be on the lookout if you have not received your stimulus check. More info here ⬇️ https://t.co/RQRRHX1hkE

Low income communities and communities of color experience disproportionate levels of air pollution and emerging evidence shows that high levels of air pollution worsen #COVID19 symptoms.  It's critical @EPA ensures air monitoring networks remain operational during the pandemic. https://t.co/MaeCMg2TsG

As we start this political sideshow in @HSGAC here’s a reminder of the work that this committee can and should be doing as #COVID19 continues to ravage our communities and our economy.  Let’s stop chasing conspiracy theories and get back to work. Read my thread 👇 https://t.co/doxvCxP4VY

In fact @EnvDefenseFund estimated that there would be more than 18000 premature deaths caused by this rollback.  That's more than half the people who live in Dover Delaware—and that's just one of the rollbacks EPA has finalized during the COVID-19 pandemic.  #PollutionPandemic https://t.co/ClfTUQkYCP

This report documents some of the emerging evidence that COVID-19 is more likely to kill people whose preexisting conditions are worsened by breathing more polluted air.  Despite this EPA has been pursuing rollbacks that will lead to more polluted air—its own #PollutionPandemic.

This @EPWDems #PollutionPandemic report describes the clear links found between climate change and the likelihood of future pandemics.  It also describes the clear evidence that other coronaviruses were more likely to cause death in those who were also exposed to air pollution.

My staff and I have spent countless hours on the phone with officials from @fema @BARDA @HHSgov @StateDept @DeptofDefense and other agencies to get the facts about the administration’s response to #COVID19.  Their answers should be before @HSGAC for all Americans to hear.

For years this committee has worked in a bipartisan way to combat the devastating opioid crisis that has plagued too many communities. Now the coronavirus is threatening to reverse the gains we have made in that fight.  That deserves a @HSGAC hearing.

Speaking of mayors our committee oversees the District of Columbia which has seen a spike in #COVID19 deaths. Let's invite @MayorBowser and hear what resources our nation's capital needs especially after being shortchanged in the #CARESAct.  That deserves a @HSGAC hearing.

After events that fundamentally changed our country — from terrorist attacks to natural disasters — our committee learned from those on the frontlines. We should hear from health care workers mayors and governors dealing with #COVID19 up close.  That deserves a @HSGAC hearing.

Last week @WSJ reported that foreign hackers were targeting U.S. universities and health care firms to steal information related to #COVID19 treatments. Let’s not waste time. Let’s examine our preparedness to combat cybersecurity threats now.   That deserves a @HSGAC hearing.

.@USPS continues to deliver life-saving drugs critical packages to homes and businesses mail ballots PPE and #COVID19 tests. Yet Congress still has not come up with a plan to address the financial crisis facing this essential agency.   That deserves a @HSGAC hearing.

.@USGAO has either undertaken or will begin investigations into more than 150 audits related to misuse of taxpayer dollars allocated in the latest #COVID19 federal relief package.  That deserves a @HSGAC hearing.

The Trump Administration launched “Project Airbridge” in March to help get PPE to those on frontlines of #COVID19 — a laudable effort. But to date @FEMA’s shipment totals are much lower than what @realDonaldTrump claims.  That deserves a @HSGAC hearing. https://t.co/43HEWkbpoa

Today we have:   - 90000+ American lives lost to #COVID19 - Depression-level unemployment across the U.S. - Persistent PPE shortages   Tomorrow we'll see:   Senate Republicans waste @HSGAC's time and resources on an unrelated political errand for President Trump.   THREAD 👇

Communities in this country seeing higher rates of COVID-19 infection and death are the same ones facing disproportionate levels of air land and water pollution.   It's not a coincidence—it's a stark reminder that environmental quality and public health are critically connected. https://t.co/ky6S6NxgmT

TUNE IN now! I’m honoring Cesarina Ramirez a team medical nurse at @westsidehealth serving her fellow Delawareans during the #COVID19 pandemic.  The United States and the First State are lucky to have you in the fight. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/Po45sckvzx

Behavioral health centers across the nation are already underfunded but now they are struggling even more as they experience an increased need for their services due to #COVID19. We can't leave those who need help behind. It's #Time2Act and #FundMentalHealth. https://t.co/OyiVijusAJ

Nearly 1/3 of the Navajo Nation does not have running water a disparity that's exacerbating the COVID-19 crisis.  Improving our nation's water infrastructure and expanding access to clean water is an urgent matter of public health & #EnvironmentalJustice. https://t.co/ATwPLB2Uaa

Low-income minority and indigenous communities disproportionately lack access to clean water which is an essential tool in our fight against #COVID19.  As we promote #HandHygiene we also need to focus on the work needed to achieve #EnvironmentalJustice. https://t.co/EVt72PgBKQ

Residential wood heaters produce a deadly mix of PM and other air toxics that amass inside and outside the home.  Meanwhile studies have shown that Americans living in areas with higher levels of PM pollution may face higher risk of death from #COVID19. https://t.co/m5oSuimWw7

If there was ever a time for the Golden Rule it’s now. #COVID19 doesn’t distinguish between Democrats and Republicans. And we can’t beat this alone. So we must do our part and take the necessary steps to help protect ourselves and others. https://t.co/NNhfyrbWVi

From #climatechange to combating #COVID19 the Trump Administration continues to suppress science and undermine experts – threatening the health of millions.    We need to be guided by science. You can read the @CDCgov full guidelines here  https://t.co/ireo5uFlx4

#COVID19 has reminded us just how important it is to have access to soap and clean water to wash hands – a simple yet effective way to prevent the spread of this deadly infectious disease.  But too many communities still lack access to clean water. https://t.co/yJWegSplDw

In the midst of a global pandemic @senatemajldr says he’s concerned with nominations. Well then let’s address positions that are relevant. Let's vet nominees who will conduct oversight of our nation's #COVID19 response and ensure relief is getting to those who need it most. https://t.co/S98S86GPNH
Let the record show that @SenateGOP just objected to a common sense bill that would simply help to ensure that federal funding is getting to the small businesses that need it most during #COVID19.
Tomorrow the men and women at Dover Air Force Base will salute the #HealthCareHeroes on the front lines of our fight against #COVID19. #DoverAFBSalutes https://t.co/BdqRmrbOoI
The Senate’s focus right now should be on making sure families and small businesses in Delaware and across the country affected by #COVID19 get the help they need. Period. https://t.co/5OzSC1q89j

Chicken farmers in Delaware and across the country continue to feed families as our nation and the world grapple with #COVID19.   We must do everything we can to ensure this vital industry and its workers affected by the pandemic have the support they need.

Proud to support @ChrisMurphyCT and @SenatorBaldwin’s Medical Supply Transparency and Delivery Act — a bill that would require the Trump Administration to increase production of #COVID19 tests and medical supplies.   This is what the Senate should be working on next week. https://t.co/TB3yKLQPPA

The ongoing COVID-19 pandemic has illustrated the importance of ensuring rapid access and response to scientific information.  I laid out my serious concerns and called on @EPA to withdraw this #CensoringScience proposal – still waiting on a response. https://t.co/gf9ZZDR2NL

A week ago @SenatorTimScott @SenatorMenendez @SenThomTillis and I urged @AmbCuiTiankai to ease export restrictions to ensure critical #COVID19 tests and PPE can reach U.S. hospitals and front line workers.  I am glad to see that they are now doing just that. https://t.co/MRXvds78h4
As we learn more about the link between PM pollution and COVID-19 it should be painfully obvious to @EPA by now that we need stronger more protective clean air standards. https://t.co/9rMeMHMt21

Recent studies found that Americans living in areas with higher levels of PM pollution may have a higher risk of death from COVID-19 than those living in areas with cleaner air.  Yet @EPA decided not to strengthen PM pollution standards. https://t.co/Gerb167B8Q

.@USPS workers risk their health and their families health to make sure homes and businesses receive critical packages and hospitals and health care workers receive #COVID19 tests and personal protective equipment.  Today and every day I am grateful for their service. https://t.co/SeeeeVPYcV

It’s heartbreaking to see so many Americans in dire straits because of #COVID19. In order for us to reopen the economy we must get the virus under control.   As @JohnCarneyDE says this process will be like using a dimmer switch. The health of our communities must come first. https://t.co/qSOyAEu2uX

This is an example of a common sense step -- supported by both Democrats and Republicans -- that we can take right now to help collect critical information on #COVID19 that we need to manage the spread of the virus before we reopen our economy safely.     Read our letter ⬇️ https://t.co/5OObV2kNO2

We can’t manage what we can’t measure.   It's why @BillCassidy and I are asking @HHSGov and @CDCgov to use existing reportable disease framework to track and log two things: #COVID19 infections and individuals who may be immune.

Our work is far from done.   Today's #COVID19 package does not provide much-needed additional funds for state and local governments to address historic revenue losses. This will continue to be a top priority of mine as work begins on the next relief package.

Today’s #COVID19 relief package includes a lot of things @SenateDems fought hard for. To name a few:   💼Funding for small businesses   🏥Hospitals and #COVID 19 testing   🗒️Contact tracing efforts that are crucial to getting the virus under control
THREAD: Once again working in a bipartisan manner resulted in a better #COVID19 relief bill than the proposal put forth by Senator McConnell.

.@SenatorTimScott @SenatorMenendez @SenThomTillis and I are urging the Chinese government to work with @StateDept to quickly address new trade requirements that are needlessly preventing life-saving medical equipment from reaching the U.S. as our nation fights #COVID19. https://t.co/patwwMsMLA

In our letter to the White House ethics official @SenWarren @SenBlumenthal and I made clear that the wealthy and well-connected should not be profiting from our government's response to #COVID19.  All health and economic decisions should be made to protect the American people. https://t.co/5zdKYvT95U

Today I told President Trump that the most important thing right now is that we are guided by science and heeding the advice of experts.  We cannot reopen the economy until we have #COVID19 under control.   https://t.co/KM3nQjOUu9

Those who know me know that I’m interested in being part of the solution. That is especially true today as we face unprecedented challenges combating #COVID19.  Read my full statement on being selected to serve on the White House bipartisan task force to help re-open the economy. https://t.co/8Ti1ko1G1k

Are you someone who was not required to file a 2018 or 2019 tax return and are eligible for the #COVID19 direct cash payment? You can enter your payment information below to get your payment ⬇️ https://t.co/Gpot6olhn8
Are you someone who filed your taxes in 2018 or 2019 and still waiting for your direct cash payment? You can now check the status of your #COVID19 direct cash payment here ⬇️ https://t.co/wmZTlZeFA6
